oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Veterans; Portrait photographs; Military standards; Flagpoles; Daggers & swords; Dogs
Confederate States of America - History; Confederate States of America - Army - Tennessee Infantry Regiment, 3rd; United States - History - Civil War, 1861-1865; Ku Klux Klan (1915 - )
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Confederate veteran John B. Kennedy is seated outdoors surrounded by his saber, his canteen, his cane, and a small dog. The flag of his regiment, the 3rd Tennessee Infantry, hangs on a pole behind him.

John Booker Kennedy served the Confederacy as a private with Company A of the 3rd Tennessee Infantry Regiment. He was wounded at Chickamauga and at Jonesboro, Georgia. A native of Giles County, Kennedy pursued the mercantile business after the war there and in Lawrence County. Kennedy was one of the six original organizers of the Ku Klux Klan on December 24, 1865, in the law office of Major Thomas M. Jones in Pulaski and proved to be the last survivor of the six.
